title: When you are a fed Jax and you go to split push, telling your team NOT TO FIGHT!!!
body:
_An ally has been slain.
An ally has been slain.
An ally has been slain.
An ally has been slain.
Quadrakill...._

http://i.imgur.com/SXBOw.gif"

Update:
I love how in the preseason Jax has moved back to his old school build.
I solo'd baron at lvl 17 with only {{item:3078}} {{item:3146}} {{item:3124}} {{item:3047}}{{item:3932}}.

replies.body:
and then the enemy team comes for you, but jokes on them, you're sated

_pentakill_

or raged
{{item:3124}}

ready to ruin your day
{{item:3153}}
Don't forget {{item:3146}}
{{item:3078}} I think we need tons of damage.

> http://i.imgur.com/SXBOw.gif"


+1 for John Stewart gif

> [{quoted}](name=Mcrarburger,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=EyIEyKBw,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2015-11-23T20:55:37.056+0000)
>
> First reply to a rioter, uhh say something witty...
> 
> http://files.gamebanana.com/img/ss/srends/5180390490816.jpg
> 
> I got nothin' ;~;

http://i.imgur.com/Fyo1hrX.gif
How is poppy doing?
We're in the memes and Games section... Not exactly the place to question a rioter on balance ;)
God damnit even the rioters do memes better than me xD

"With only"

Proceeds to list 1 item short of a full build

Generally, this is a very bad idea. If you're playing with a team who you don't think will cooperate with your split-pushing strategy, the onus is on you not to split-push and put your team in a bad spot. Cohesive team-work is much much MUCH more important than your plan. Because your plan is useless if your team doesn't go along with it, no matter how good it is. 

I have seen WAY WAY more games lost because one player wants to split push when the rest of the team wants to group, than I have seen won by someone deciding to split-push at the right time. Even worse though, there are a plethora of items and abilities in the game that allow a player or team to force engages. Hell, some champions have that as pretty much their entire jobs. In effect, your team cannot always choose not to engage.

People also dont know how to not get engaged on. Back off a little when the leona runs up to start a 5v4? Nah just stand still let her go in and blame whoever wasnt there because hey, helplessness gets elo
The best part is when after they die they go "wtf are you doing jax group this meaningless section of the jungle while dragon and baron are down is very important and we must fight for it."

And then they send matzahar to deal with you

No QQS=GG
Why not just team fight if your fed. You should win the teamfight easily.

You could look at it either way. Split pushing is a great strategy because it forces 1-2 enemies to break away from the main fight to come deal with you. If you, Jax, kill the two coming to get you, GG. If they send more than 2 people to deal with you, the rest of your team has a huge advantage. 

IF DONE RIGHT!!!! Split-pushing is an incredible strategy.

> [{quoted}](name=Fritterz,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=EyIEyKBw,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-11-23T15:10:46.985+0000)
>
> You could look at it either way. Split pushing is a great strategy because it forces 1-2 enemies to break away from the main fight to come deal with you. If you, Jax, kill the two coming to get you, GG. If they send more that 2 people to deal with you, the rest of your team has a huge advantage. 
> 
> IF DONE RIGHT!!!! Split-pushing is an incredible strategy.

In a coordinated team with a push mirroring each other on opposite ends of the lane, yes.

In solo que?  You'll have a hard time getting people to cooperate becuase "F u noob.  You don't get to tell me how to play."

It's a balancing act on when you can and can't.

Solo Queue....

When I play Jax and try to split push I type in all caps

"DO NOT FIGHT, JUST APPLY PRESSURE IN MID LANE!!! PLEASE DO NOT FIGHT!!!"

> [{quoted}](name=Fritterz,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=EyIEyKBw,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-23T15:18:57.381+0000)
>
> Solo Queue....
> 
> When I play Jax and try to split push I type in all caps
> 
> "DO NOT FIGHT, JUST APPLY PRESSURE IN MID LANE!!! PLEASE DO NOT FIGHT!!!"

It's Solo queue. . . .

What do you expect?
Correct split pushing works great for high level play when a team member can 1v1 anyone on enemy team. The enemy team has enough wave clear to stop a regular push and has no hard engage.
Jax :) the 1v1 king.
{{champion:75}}
Nasus plz. A fed Jax can eat a fed Nasus alive 1v1.

No. Rageblade. Gunblade. Whatever you will not 1v1 a properly farmed Nasus who knows what they are doing with a jax. The only way I would ever lose a 1v1 to a jax on Nasus is if my team has fed terribly.

Pfffft, if this is a 15/0 Jax vs a 0/10 Nasus who has less than 100 CS, of course Jax will win because that's just straight up unfair

But no Jax will ever be able to take down a competent Nasus. You can stack all the attack speed you want, Wither will cut it in half and all your damage items don't make you nearly as tanky as a Nasus who's built like a Tank because Jax's ult doesn't last forever.

Jax ult? Wither and retreat until it wears off, then fight again.
Jax E? Q goes through it, even if it didn't, Wither, retreat, return

I can only assume by your comment that you must've recently been stomped by a fed Jax
They just fixed the q thing
Then my 2nd point still stands. Wither, retreat, return

No sir, I was the Jax. I am by no means an expert. But I would not blow my ult or my E until wither has run out. It's all about the timing. I will admit a 1000 stack Nasus could probably 1v1 just about anyone. But few ...Nasuses... Nasus'... Nasi... Nasen... hmmm... I'll go with Nasuses ever get to that point.

I don't even need 1k stacks to take on a Jax as Nasus, 450 will do in most cases, especially with Jax's new squishier builds

Anyway, this must've been a really stupid Nasus you beat down, or if you're speaking from theory then let me break down some numbers:

Its now possible to get 40% CDR with {{item:3065}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3057}}, assuming Nasus is farming competently these 3 items net to being 6650 gold and about 360 stacks around 20 minutes, cheaper than {{item:3078}} {{item:3124}}{{item:1053}} which nets to 7200 gold{{item:3078}} {{item:3124}} alone add up to 6300 gold. Or if you don't opt for a Triforce, then {{item:3124}} {{item:3146}} add up to 5900, with a {{item:3057}} , that's 6950 or a {{item:3044}} its 7100

If you were jungling, then {{item:1415}} or {{item:3931}} {{item:3124}} {{item:3078}} adds up to 8750 gold, if you want to break apart the triforce pieces, then it'll add up at the cheapest with {{item:3057}} at 6000 gold

Oh cool, finally a cheaper build than Nasus' right? Alright cool...but you have way less health and Nasus' HP pool and resistances with his items will allow him to shred apart Jax, 90 extra armor
Nasus gets 70 extra MR and 500 extra HP vs a Jax who is relying entirely on his nerfed to oblivion base stats and a full damage build, at most he'll get 250 more HP with his laning build with a Triforce

With 40% CDR I can almost PERMA-WITHER a Jax, with a rank 1 wither (with a STUPID nasus), that's a 9 second CD with a 5 second duration meaning 4 seconds Jax can viably fight back. With Rank 5 Wither (a SMART Nasus) this will be 7.6 second CD, 2.6 seconds Jax can viably fight back

BUT WAIT: Frozen heart reduces attack speed by 15% and stacks with Wither! Even without wither, when Jax (A champion who relies almost entirely on autoattacks) jumps on him, he immediately loses 15% of his attack speed. Even worse is he needs to keep attacking to get his own speed stacks

Additionally: the new jungle nets 34 less gold per clear and than before whereas lane minions net more gold, even worse for Jax: The items all got jacked up in price!. This means that while the jungle Jax build is cheaper, it's harder for him to get the gold for his items. He will NEED to get fed to get his items in time vs a farming Nasus and if he does this, he has less devourer stacks

For laning: Nasus has sustain, Jax doesn't. A stupid Nasus will let Jax bully and zone him, a competent Nasus will trade back and abuse his sustain advantage. The CS, and gold, should swing towards Nasus' favor

In other words: Jax vs Nasus...very strongly in Nasus' favor, the Jax must rely almost entirely on being fed and the Nasus being stupid/very behind to stand a chance
You realize jax can now dodge nasus's q right?

And if you'll notice I addressed that in response to Ravoria's post

But it's but a small victory for Jax. Doesn't change the fact Nasus' core items are overall easier to obtain, counterstrike has a longer cooldown than Siphoning Strike and Wither, and the fact Nasus can wither, retreat, return, and kill Jax or that Jax has no way to deny a Nasus' farm unless there is a huge skill difference, ie a Plat Jax vs a Silver Nasus or a new Nasus who can't farm

> [{quoted}](name=WutsKraken,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=EyIEyKBw,comment-id=00010000000100000001000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-25T00:08:19.014+0000)
>
> And if you'll notice I addressed that in response to Ravoria's post
> 
> But it's but a small victory for Jax. Doesn't change the fact Nasus' core items are overall easier to obtain, counterstrike has a longer cooldown than Siphoning Strike and Wither, and the fact Nasus can wither, retreat, return, and kill Jax or that Jax has no way to deny a Nasus' farm unless there is a huge skill difference, ie a Plat Jax vs a Silver Nasus or a new Nasus who can't farm

Incorrect, a Jax can actually bully Nasus out of lane especially after he hits 6 purely by stacking his ult proc, then whacking Nasus with it followed by a W proc. This does a lot more damage than a Nasus Q, and if nasus withers Jax, he can simply leap away having done twice as much damage to Nasus. Sure, Nasus can heal up if the minion wave is at his tower, but if not he just lost a big trade, which Jax can rinse-repeat until he wants to all in with his E.

As a Nasus main, I am fully aware of how this matchup works, as Jax I've won this lane before as well.
Against a competent Nasus: you can poke me down all you want with the level 6 trick, and I will begin losing trades. However it doesn't change the fact that unless I'm being VERY stupid, you will only be able to harass and not kill me, I can in return weather the storm like every other Nasus vs X matchup because Jax has to push the lane for his lvl 6 trick by autoattacking 2 minions within the time span of his passive duration

> [{quoted}](name=WutsKraken,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=EyIEyKBw,comment-id=0001000000010000000100000001,timestamp=2015-11-23T22:02:54.281+0000)
>
> Pfffft, if this is a 15/0 Jax vs a 0/10 Nasus who has less than 100 CS, of course Jax will win because that's just straight up unfair
> 
> But no Jax will ever be able to take down a competent Nasus. You can stack all the attack speed you want, Wither will cut it in half and all your damage items don't make you nearly as tanky as a Nasus who's built like a Tank because Jax's ult doesn't last forever.
> 
> Jax ult? Wither and retreat until it wears off, then fight again.
> Jax E? Q goes through it, even if it didn't, Wither, retreat, return
> 
> I can only assume by your comment that you must've recently been stomped by a fed Jax

Nasus and Jax are two of my favourite champions. You have this matchup completely wrong though.

Q does indeed go through Jax's E, that was Nasus's only saving grace - but that will be changed soon. When it does, this will be 100% in favour of Jax. Even so, until then, Jax can react to wither the same way Nasus can react to Jax's E. If Nasus withers Jax, Jax can then activate E, use his W on Nasus and Q away. If Nasus ults, Jax can also ult. It does depend greatly on skill this matchup, the first to get a thornmail usually wins (thornmail reflects Q damage from Nasus, did you know). But in my experience playing as both champions vs the other one, Jax has a very slight advantage up until Nasus can get around 500 stacks.

This is also assuming a Jax who is much more skilled than the Nasus, as Nasus I will never wither a Jax unless I am going all-in or he is going aggressive, in the situation you described, this sounds like a Nasus who preemptively withers a Jax for no reason and even if so, a WQ combo from Nasus costs less mana than all of the abilities Jax must use to win the trade

From my experience, after 200 stacks I can start to destroy Jax in duels no matter his items
Just gonna ignore Nasus/Yi/Tryndamere/Udyr/Yasuo huh

> [{quoted}](name=Fritterz,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=EyIEyKBw,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-11-23T15:10:46.985+0000)
>
> You could look at it either way. Split pushing is a great strategy because it forces 1-2 enemies to break away from the main fight to come deal with you. If you, Jax, kill the two coming to get you, GG. If they send more than 2 people to deal with you, the rest of your team has a huge advantage. 
> 
> IF DONE RIGHT!!!! Split-pushing is an incredible strategy.

It is...and it isn't. The problem with splitting is that usually the most fed guy feels obligated to do the splitting, and this allows the enemy to catch up by feasting on your weaker allies. One must understand where the team's power is allocated. If it's all front-loaded into just one guy or if a very important piece of the team's ability to team fight at all (even on defense) is the one trying to leave, splitting can easily lead to throws. I don't condone splitting unless there's a comfy advantage over the enemy already + the enemy hasn't started grouping up properly yet.
If you trust your team to not flash engage a 4v5 on the enemy tank. Even people in diamond dont understand how to do headcounts
Jax has a team? Thought it was 1v5... hmmm
Many champs can solo baron at 17 with that and sometimes less.
Look, I solod baron at 20 min as an aatrox with Gunblade, Rageblade and Sated. Thats a bit better IMO

Bruh, I know the feeling.
{{champion:75}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:157}}
The feeling when it's tryndamere vs tryndamere top and you manage a solo inhib at 15 minutes.

xin zhao can solo baron at the 20 min mark, with {{item:3124}} {{item:3932}} {{item:3146}}  and come out FULL HP.

he can also solo tank the nexus towers, without any armor but not at the 20 min mark.

Try it in a bot game if you guys don't believe me.

and then they be like "report jax for not helping team"
this happens WAY too much to me.
